title: How To Protect Your COVID-19 Vaccine Card: Health Officials
author: Amie Schaenzer
description: The McHenry County Department of Health offers advice on how to preserve your card, have it accessible when needed.
cleaned_text: Protect Your COVID-19 Vaccine Card: Health Officials The McHenry County Department of Health offers advice on how to preserve your card, have it accessible when needed. MCHENRY COUNTY, IL — The McHenry County Department of Health is reminding residents vaccinated against COVID-19 to contact their physician to find out how they can enter their vaccination card information into their medical records. As more businesses and employers are requiring proof of vaccination against COVID-19, having a record of your vaccination will prevent missed time from work or access to certain businesses and facilities according to a news release. Those [traveling internationally](https://travel.state.gov/content/travel/en/traveladvisories/ea/covid-19-information1.html) may be required to show proof of vaccination. "Unless you currently have COVID-19 or are already vaccinated against the disease, it's not too late to protect yourself by getting vaccinated," said Melissa Adamson, public health administrator for the McHenry County Department of Health. "Having a plan to safeguard your vaccine card and showing proof of your vaccine may be the difference between going to work or unexpected missed time." Those who have misplaced their vaccination card should contact the vaccine provider to find out how to get a replacement, according to a news release from the health department. Anyone who received their vaccine at an MCDH clinic, including clinics in McHenry County managed by Curative, can get a record of their vaccination card through MCDH. To get a copy of your COVID-19 vaccination record from MCDH, make an appointment by calling 815-334-4510, Monday through Friday, between 8 a.m. and 4:30 p.m. The cost to replace the record is $2, and a release of information and photo identification is required at the time of your appointment to receive the record. If you are vaccinated against the disease, MCDH recommends you do the following: - Contact your physician to find out how to enter your vaccination card into your health record - Take a photo of your vaccination card for backup proof - Do not laminate your vaccination card - Enter your vaccination history or test results into a [SMART Health Card](https://smarthealth.cards/faq.html#benefits) - Opt-in to either [v-safe](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/vsafe.html)or [VaxText](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/reporting/vaxtext/index.html)as a way to preserve vaccination information - Register with the Illinois Department of Public Health's [Vax Verify](https://idphportal.illinois.gov/s/?language=en_US)to request your immunization records Find out where to get vaccinated against COVID-19 by visiting [vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/). To schedule an appointment at an MCDH clinic, visit [https://bit.ly/MCDHCOVIDVaxLoc](https://bit.ly/MCDHCOVIDVaxLoc).
